Dalami Defisit dan Iuran, Hari Ini DPR Panggil BPJS Kesehatan
06 Nov 2019, 00:58 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi IX Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat akan kembali memanggil Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan pada Rabu, 6 November 2019 ini, untuk rapat dengar pendapat. Rapat tersebut bakal membahas pendalaman kenaikan iuran premi asuransi hingga defisit yang ditanggung BPJS Kesehatan.
“Besok kami diundang rapat pukul 10.00 WIB secara khusus membahas JKN KIS (Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional Kartu Indonesia Sehat),” ujar Direktur Utama BPJS Kesehatan Fachmi Idris saat ditemui di kompleks Parlemen Senayan, Jakarta, Selasa petang, 5 November 2019.
Selain merembuk persoalan-persoalan yang tengah dihadapi, bos BPJS Kesehatan ini akan memaparkan profil lembaganya secara mendetail. Profil yang ia sampaikan meliputi jumlah kepesertaan iuran jaminan kesehatan, baik peserta pribadi maupun subsidi.
Fachmi mengimbuhkan, pihaknya juga akan mendetailkan tugas dan tanggung jawab BPJS Kesehatan secara menyeluruh. Adapun rapat pagi ini merupakan tindak lanjut rapat gabungan sebelumnya yang digelar oleh DPR pada September lalu.
Sejatinya, Komisi IX telah memanggil BPJS Kesehatan dalam rapat dengar pendapat dan rapat kerja bersama Kementerian Kesehatan pada Selasa siang kemarin. Namun, pertemuan itu akhirnya hanya sempat membahas pengenalan program masing-masing kementerian dan lembaga untuk periode kerja lima tahun ke depan.
Kemarin, Ketua Komisi IX Felly Estelita meminta para anggotanya untuk tidak mencecar BPJS Kesehatan ihwal perkara defisit dan kenaikan iuran terlebih dahulu. “Karena kita akan lakukan pendalaman Rabu besok,” tuturnya.
Pemerintah sebelumnya resmi menaikkan iuran program JKN yang dikelola BPJS Kesehatan. Kenaikan ini seiring terbitnya Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas Perpres Nomor 82 Tahun 2018 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan pada 24 Oktober 2019.
Seluruh segmen peserta BPJS Kesehatan tercatat mengalami kenaikan iuran. Peserta Penerima Bantuan Iuran (PBI) meningkat dari Rp 23.000 menjadi Rp 42.000. Kenaikan iuran PBI yang berasal dari anggaran pemerintah ini berlaku surut pada 1 Agustus 2019.

In Deficit and Contribution, Today DPR Call BPJS Health
Nov 6 2019, 00:58 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Commission IX of the House of Representatives will again call the Health Insurance Administering Body (BPJS) on Wednesday, November 6, 2019, for a hearing. The meeting will discuss the deepening of the increase in insurance premium contributions to the deficit borne by BPJS Health.
"Tomorrow we are invited to a meeting at 10:00 WIB specifically to discuss JKN KIS (National Health Insurance for Indonesia Healthy Cards)," said Director of BPJS Health Fachmi Idris when he was met at the Senayan Parliament complex, Jakarta, Tuesday evening, 5 November 2019.
In addition to discussing the problems being faced, the BPJS Health boss will explain his institution's profile in detail. His profile includes the number of health insurance contribution participants, both private participants and subsidies.
Fachmi added that he would also detail the duties and responsibilities of the Health BPJS as a whole. This morning's meeting was a follow-up to the previous joint meeting held by the Parliament last September.
In fact, Commission IX has summoned BPJS Health in a hearing and working meeting with the Ministry of Health on Tuesday afternoon yesterday. However, the meeting finally only had time to discuss the introduction of the programs of each ministry and agency for the next five-year work period.
Yesterday, Chair of Commission IX Felly Estelita asked its members not to strike BPJS on the matter of the deficit case and the increase in fees in advance. "Because we will deepen tomorrow," he said.
Previously the government officially raised the JKN program fees managed by the Health BPJS. This increase is in line with the issuance of Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 75 of 2019 concerning Amendment to Perpres Number 82 of 2018 concerning Health Insurance on October 24, 2019.
All BPJS Health participant segments recorded an increase in fees. Participants Receiving Donation Assistance (PBI) increased from Rp. 23,000 to Rp. 42,000. The increase in PBI contributions from the government budget will apply retroactively on August 1, 2019.
